Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content:
@jl777c 
What are the odds of Komodo (Ecosystem) ever developing a blockchain of collectibles--or what's referred to as non-fungible? And I say this thinking of maybe using it, to teach---like smart contracts, for example.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: assets CC has supported non-fungible token for months

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
@Privatoshi i asked a similar question only yesterday about bundling unique digital assets
```
non-fungible tokens are possible right now with the tokens contract.
We just need to use 1 satoshi of KMD(or whatever base coin) to create the tokens, 
then only one token with an id is created (so it has a unique token id). 
Later, whoever has the token can add op-return data to it.
GUI side can deal with the rules on how the OP-return data is interpreted

creating bundles of assets can be done with another CC that enforces such restrictions
```

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: @jl777c  is there a limit to how many chains can be in a cluster?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 60000 can be all running on the same node, but you start to run out of ports. however, you can visualize a cluster as a set of non-overlapping subsets, so theoretically there is no limit other than how many can be notarized. likely there will be some practical limit that is there though

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I would like to find this limit at some point, but I think its mostly hardware and network limited rather than. Software which makes it quite hard.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can have nodes that connect to only 10% of all the chains, randomly selected. even with port collision, netmagic would keep the networks separate, so maybe 600,000 chains? at some point the network contention of many chains on same port would likely be an issue
